abstract: Controversy surrounds Tokyo's Olympic stadium designed by Pritzker-winning architect Zaha Hadid and set to be built for 2020 Summer Games; some Japanese architects disapprove of design, underscoring strong emotions and opinions that surround Olympic stadiums, expensive public projects that can come to represent country's identity.
lead_paragraph: The debate over an Olympic stadium to be built for the 2020 Summer Games illustrates how the structures have become potent symbols of architectural prowess and economic pride.

byline.contributor: Hisako Ueno contributed reporting from Tokyo.
byline.original: By AMY QIN and ROBIN POGREBIN

snippet: The debate over an Olympic stadium to be built for the 2020 Summer Games illustrates how the structures have become potent symbols of architectural prowess and economic pride.

headline.main: National Pride at a Steep Price
headline.seo: Olympic Stadium in Tokyo Is Dogged by Controversy
headline.print_headline: National Pride at a Steep Price
